thread.title: Peter Dailey Sold Americans on Ronald Reagan’s Common Sense With TV Ads in 1980

author: James R. Hagerty
title: Peter Dailey Sold Americans on Ronald Reagan’s Common Sense With TV Ads in 1980
text:
Peter Dailey, a Los Angeles-based advertising mogul and former college football player, had his biggest assignment in 1980: selling Ronald Reagan to the American public.
In crafting television ads, his aim was to show the Republican presidential nominee as an experienced governor with a calm, common-sense approach, not a washed-up movie actor...
